title: Black Screen During Champion Select (Beta client)
body:
>#Update 7th Mar @ 11:30AM PST

>Hey everyone,

>We  deployed a Hotfix that should have resolved this issue. If you happen to still run into this, be sure to submit your client logs in a support ticket, as mentioned in the original post below so we can help you out further.

>Thanks!

_____

Hey guys,

We've received reports that some players are seeing a black screen in champion select since patch 7.4.  Normally, black screens tend to be connection related but this specific circumstance is a bug.

We're currently requesting logs to further investigate and pump out a fix faster!  If you've installed League in the default directory, you can find the log files by following this path:  

**C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Logs\LeagueClient Logs\**

In that folder, you'll want to provide the following log file types:
>* LeagueClient.log
* LeagueClientUx.log

Attach them to a [**support ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and send it our way!  

In the meantime, collapsing your friends list groups before queuing for a match, may serve as a temporary workaround. Here's a screenshot showing what that looks like:

https://i.imgur.com/wMLOFya.png
_____
We'll post here with any further info and updates, as they become available. Thank you for your patience while we look into this issue further.

replies.body:
Please, don't presume everyone got their games installed on C:\

Like any proper PC user, I don't install games on the C:\ -drive. Which means I don't have a C:\Rito Gems-folder at all.
"D:\GAMES\League of Legends\Logs\LeagueClient Logs" (in _my_ case) on the other hand...

Whenever I describe a file address, I write it as the universally accepted "fill in as necessary":
>[X]:\League of Legends\Logs\LeagueClient Logs\

Whenever anyone states a _specific_ file address, it adds confusion, because some games forces logs, saves, certain gamefiles etc. on a specific location (Ubisoft is notorious in doing this). 
Meaning, even if the game itself is installed elsewhere, the logs or whatever could still be located on that specific location, whether you want them to be or not.
And that often results in unnecessary double-checking.
